* Parses a string representation of a task from storage and converts it into a Task object.
* @param input The string representation of the task from storage.

return new Event(desE, isMark, start, end);

* Parses a date and time string into a LocalDateTime object to be stored in task.
* @param input The date and time string in the format "d/M/yyyy HHmm".
* @throws TinaException if the date and time format is invalid.
throw new TinaException("Invalid date and time format");
* Formats a LocalDateTime object into a custom string representation.
* @param input The LocalDateTime object to be formatted.
* @return A string of the date and time in the custom format "MMM dd yyyy HH:mm".
DateTimeFormatter formatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy HH:mm");
* The Storage class handles reading from and writing to a file that stores the task list.
* It provides methods to write tasks to the file and read tasks from the file.
* Constructs a new Storage object with the specified filename.
* @param filename The name of the file where tasks will be stored.
File directory = file.getParentFile(); // Get the parent directory
* Writes the given list of tasks to the file.
* @param list The list of tasks to be written to the file.
* @throws TinaException if an error occurs while writing to the file.
public void write(ArrayList<Task> list) throws TinaException {
throw new TinaException("Error occurred while writing the task list to the file");
* Reads the list of tasks from the file.
* @return An ArrayList of tasks read from the file.
* @throws TinaException if an error occurs while reading from the file.
throw new TinaException("Error occurred while reading the task list from the file");
* The TaskList class manages a list of tasks and handles operations such as adding, marking, unmarking, listing, and deleting tasks.
* It interacts with the Storage class to persist the task list to a file.
* Constructs a new TaskList object with a specified Storage object.
* The task list is initialized by reading from storage file.
* @param storage The Storage object that handles file operations for the task list.
* Adds a task to the list and saves the updated list to storage.
* Displays a confirmation message including the new task and the total number of tasks.
* @param task The task to be added to the list.
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.printf("Now you have %d tasks in the list.%n", list.size());
* Marks a task as completed and saves the updated list to storage.
* Displays a confirmation message including the marked task.
* @param x The index of the task to be marked as completed.
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* Unmarks a task and saves the updated list to storage.
* Displays a confirmation message including the unmarked task.
* @param x The index of the task to be unmarked.
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
* Lists all tasks in the task list with their current status.
* Displays the tasks with their respective indices.
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Deletes a task from the list and saves the updated list to storage.
* Displays a confirmation message including the deleted task and the total number of remaining tasks.
* @param x The index of the task to be deleted.
System.out.printf("Now you have %d tasks in the list.%n", list.size());
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
* The Ui class handles user interaction, including greeting the user, processing commands, and exiting the application.
* Greets the user with a welcome message and a logo.
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
* Displays a farewell message when the user exits the application.
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Continuously reads user input, processes commands, and interacts with the task list until the user enter "bye".
* @param tasks The TaskList object that holds the list of tasks and handles task-related operations.
* Represents a task with a deadline.
* A Deadline object contains a string description, a boolean to mark completion,
* and the date/time by which the task should be completed.
* Constructs a new Deadline object with the specified description and end time when parsed from user.
* @param des The description of the task.
* @param end The end time of the task, in a parsable date-time string format.
* Constructs a new Deadline object with the specified description,
* completion status, and end time, when parsed from storage
* @param des The description of the task.
* @param isMark The completion status of the task.
* @param end The end time of the task, in a parsable date-time string format.
public Deadline(String des, boolean isMark, String end) {
* Returns the description of the task, including its type and formatted end time.
* @return A string of the task description.
* Returns a string representation of the task for storage purposes.
* @return A string representing the task in a format for saving to a file.
* Represents an event task with a start and end time.
* An Event object contains a string description, a boolean to mark completion,
* and the start and end date/time of the event.
* Constructs a new Event object with the specified description, start time, and end time when parsed from user.
* @param des The description of the event.
* @param start The start time of the event, in a parsable date-time string format.
* @param end The end time of the event, in a parsable date-time string format.
public Event(String des, String start, String end) {
* Constructs a new Event object with the specified description,
* completion status, start time, and end time when parsed from storage
* @param des The description of the event.
* @param isMark The completion status of the event.
* @param start The start time of the event, in a parsable date-time string format.
* @param end The end time of the event, in a parsable date-time string format.
public Event(String des, boolean isMark, String start, String end) {
* Returns the description of the event, including its type and formatted start and end times.
* @return A string of the event description.
* Returns a string representation of the event for storage purposes.
* @return A string of the event in a format for saving to a file.
return String.format("E %d %s | %s | %s", isMark? 1 : 0, des, start, end);
* Represents a task with a description and completion status.
* A Task object contains a description and methods to mark or unmark the task as completed.
* Constructs a new Task object with the specified description.
* @param des The description of the task.
* @throws TinaException if the description is empty.
throw new TinaException("Enter your description after the space");
* Unmarks the task, indicating it is not completed.
* Returns the description of the task, including its completion status.
* @return A string of the task description, with "[X]" if marked, or "[ ]" if not.
* A Todo object contains a description and a boolean to mark completion.
* Constructs a new Todo object with the specified description when parsed from user.
* @param des The description of the task.
* Constructs a new Todo object with the specified description and completion status
* @param des The description of the task.
* @param isMark The completion status of the task.
* Returns the description of the task, including its type.
* @return A string representing the task description.
* Returns a string representation of the task for storage purposes.
* @return A string representing the task in a format for saving to a file.
assertEquals("Invalid date and time format", e.getMessage());
assertEquals("[E][ ] project meeting (from: Dec 02 2019 18:00 to: Dec 02 2019 19:00)", e.getDes());
assertEquals("Invalid date and time format", e.getMessage());
